Title: the thanksgiving decoupling

Leonard: The math is all there. It’s not real.
Were you drunk?
I think you’re the one who fell over.
It’d actually be nice to not hear Sheldon complain about my cooking all day.
I want to go.
You did?
Wait, you went to a chapel?
Why?
Penny, you know those are real, right?
Yeah, they are.
Yeah, they are.
I can’t believe you’re married to that idiot.
Well, a goof or not, you’re actually married. You need to get this taken care of.
I’m hoping you can get an annulment. It’s just like it never happened.
Oh, she’s mad at me because she just found out she’s married to Zack.
Okay, I found the, uh, court papers that you and Zack need to fill out. I’ll print them when we get home.
And we can just put this whole thing behind us.
What?
Why are you mad at me? You’re the one that did the stupid thing. I’m just trying to fix it.
Wuh, Penny.
How am I the bad guy? She’s the one who married someone else. I’m the victim.
Sure.
Wait, you invited him here?
Come on.
I just don’t understand why you invited him here today.
Well, you might have to cook for one more because she invited Zack.
Sorry she made you come over here on a holiday.
Yeah, uh, you guys have to sign here and here. On Monday, we’ll file for the annulment, and this marriage will be over.
Why won’t you sign it?
You married him instead of me? Good call. Sign the papers.
That is not true.
You’re the one who invited him here.
Yeah, well, she’s not gonna be your wife for long.
I’m sorry, too.
Penny: Yes, it is.
Oh, stop it. I’ve seen you eat, like, a million hamburgers.
Look, I’m telling you I’ve done it, okay? I clearly remember the cow standing up and then the cow on its side.
I was 16 in Nebraska. What do you think?
That would explain why the sky was also on its side.
Howard. Cow tipping. Real or not?
Uh, we were actually gonna do it here.
Yeah, me, too.
Sheldon, you can have a nice Thanksgiving anywhere. I spent one in Vegas.

Yeah, back when I was dating Zack. It was actually more fun than I thought. We gambled, we went to one of those cheesy wedding chapels, we had a really good turkey dinner. Which was surprising, since we were at a strip club.
Yeah.
We had one of those silly fake weddings.
No, they’re not.
No, they’re not.
But it didn’t seem real.
Ugh, would you stop? We just did it as a goof.
I will. Why are you making this such a big deal?
So how do I undo this?
Great, well, what do I have to do?
Want of understanding? What does that even mean?
Here. Thank you for having us.
I can’t believe I felt bad for opening this in the car.
Fine.
Are you done?
Look, I get it, I screwed up. Is this all we’re gonna talk about the rest of the day?
Ugh, I need some air.
Well, you’ll be happy to know I just spoke to Zack and he’s willing to sign the court papers. He’s on his way here now.
Yeah.
Because you wouldn’t shut up about it. When I called him, he had nothing to do, so I just thought it would…
Oh, sorry. We’ll keep it down.
Yeah, okay, great. Can we just get this over with?
Okay.
We don’t have any kids.
Okay, look, Zack, come on. You know neither of us thought this was real. I mean, we were married by an Elvis impersonator.
Hang on. You know what? You have been a jerk about this all day. You always do this, whenever I mess up, you’re right there to make me feel even worse about it.
Yeah, we could’ve waited till Monday, signed the papers, this all would have been over.
Oh, there you go again, just another mistake you’re throwing in my face.
I’m about to. Sign the paper.
Hey, I’m sorry about today. And I promise, next time I get married, it won’t be a joke. It’ll be for love. Or money.
Sheldon: Yeah,uh, look, it is scientifically impossible for a person to tip a cow. Even you, with your stocky build and lumberjack shoulders, you couldn’t do it.
Mmm. You know, I’ve been told that a bald refusal of an invitation is rude and one must instead offer up a polite excuse, so I’d love to go, but, unfortunately, that sounds awful.
Oh, since you put it that way, I’d love to go, but that sounds even more awful.
Uh, excuse me, but every year you prepare a terrible meal and every year I criticize it. Do our traditions mean nothing to you?
Ugh, fine, I’ll go. But if her food is delicious, Thanksgiving is ruined, and it’s on you.
Do we really have to go to Mrs. Wolowitz’s house?
Now I know how the African slaves felt. Being dragged from their homes to labour under the yoke of the white man.
Yes.
He’s right.
Let me ask you a question. At any point, was Las Vegas on its side?
Yes. Like we’re on a ship. Coming from Africa to America.
Yes, Miss Amy.
Oh, oh, oh, I have a reason. It could be because you said yes to marrying Zack, but every time Leonard’s proposed, he’s gotten a resounding no. Yeah, that’s just off the top of my head.
Hah!Penny? Next.
It smells wonderful. Is anyone slaving away in the kitchen? Because I, too, know…
I don’t know the first thing about women, but I would not follow her.
They passed against a nickel defence. They should have run it off-tackle.
My father loved football. He always made me watch it before I was allowed to do my homework.
I would throw a quick slant to a wideout, given that the defence is showing blitz.
I don’t care for your mother’s bathroom. There’s not an angle to do one’s business without a clown figurine staring at you.
1993. Leon Lett blew the game in the final seconds and the Dolphins emerged victorious. Then I finally got to do my calculus.
So was my dad. And then he did.
No. He died when I was 14.
So was the man who owned the local liquor store. He cried and cried.
No, sir. He did try to give me one for my high school graduation, but I was 11 and my mom said no.
All right.
Do you mind? We’re having a moment here.

All I know is you can only fit one of her in a car. And there’s the clown that came out of her. I really didn’t want to come here, but this is shaping up to be one of the best Thanksgivings I’ve had in a long time.
She’s so tiny. It’s funny when she’s mad.
Perhaps you’re right. I’m sorry for my behaviour. I’ve had alcohol, and it’s caused me to be inappropriate.
Ain’t she great?
Now, how’s about you get us a couple of beers?
This is a Jewish house. I don’t think they have pigskin.
I just vomited on a lot of clowns.
Raj: It’s horrible. Why would you push a cow over? They’re sacred.
Hey, an animal can be both sacred and delicious.
Ah, no problem. It wouldn’t be Thanksgiving without an Indian providing the food. Uh, now, where does your mom keep the Crisco?
Uh, yeah, can you, uh, reach that, uh, gravy boat up there?

Great. That makes one of you. Okay, we have a lot to do and not much time to do it. Bernadette, you’re on corn, gravy and yam detail. Amy, you’re on rolls, cranberries and making sure Bernadette stays away from the marshmallows. That’s right, I see you. Okay, if you have any questions, I’ll be over here basting my ass off. Focus is key.
Hey, guys, I’m trying to cook in here.
No, no, speak up. I’m about to use the blender, and I don’t want to miss anything.
My, my. The plot, like my gravy, thickens.
Wonder what she saw in that guy.
Hmm. Wonder what she sees in Leonard.
Well, I couldn’t have done it without my two favourite girls. Martha Stewart and Rachael Ray.
Howard: Hey.
Mmm. I’m gonna say not. That’s just based on me trying to roll my mom over when she’s snoring. Speaking of that big side of beef, uh, she’s invited all of you to Thanksgiving at her house.
Come on, it’ll be fun.
Please? Bernadette’s bringing her dad ’cause her mom’s out of town, and I never have anything to say to that guy.
Sheldon.
Oh, her gout’s flaring up. Turns out an apple pie a day does not keep the doctor away.
Maybe because that little piggy is being crushed by the barn. She should quiet down soon. I gave her enough pain meds to choke a, well, her.
I have a better idea.
I was gonna make Raj do it all by himself.
Um, I don’t know. Probably in a wad in her cheek.
He doesn’t want me in there. I’m the creepy little guy who has sex with his daughter.
Does he?
Really?
So your wife’s in Arizona with the grandkids?

You know, my mom’s been to Arizona. She rode one of those mules down in the Grand Canyon. Long story short, they had to shoot it. ‘Cause she’s so fat. I’ll get the door while you finish laughing. Hey, guys.
What’s with you?
Really? That dumb-ass she used to date? That’s hysterical.
You ever play football?
No. But I did get tackled in the hallway once. The whole school cheered.
Sounds like Zack’s the victim. You’re sleeping with his wife.
Oh, I love a good blitz, especially with sour cream. Get it? ‘Cause it sounds like blintz.
That’s why I sit.
Anyone need a beer?
Thank God.
Here you go.
I never had a beer with my dad, either.
Sheldon and your dad are bonding and completely ignoring me.
They’re drinking beer and watching football.
They don’t want me.
Well, Sheldon started talking about how his dad isn’t alive any more, and they were toasting, and I tried to tell them about how sad I was when my dad abandoned…
Don’t worry about it.
Mike, that’s the nicest thing you’ve ever said to me.
Amy: We do. And I expect you to be on your best behaviour.
Are you honestly comparing Thanksgiving dinner at Wolowitz’s mom’s with one of the greatest tragedies in the history of mankind?
Sheldon, that’s completely inappropriate. You can’t keep comparing yourself to a slave.
It says here you can get an annulment if any of the following conditions are met. Were you unable to consummate the marriage?
Is there any evidence of fraud, bigamy, want of understanding?
Ding, ding, ding. We have a winner.
Did you guys know Penny married Zack three years ago?
I can’t believe Penny’s married to Zack.
I know how you feel. Sheldon ignored me for a week when he got that Roomba vacuum. I kick it when he’s not looking.
All right, mister, I think you owe Howard and Bernadette an apology.
Bernadette: Hi, Dad.
Oh, you brought beer for everybody.
You can have a quiet day and watch the game here.
I guess we’re gonna have to do all the cooking.
If you think you’re gonna make me do all this by myself, you’re crazy.
Oh, well, that’s a great idea.
Thanks for saving the day.
I’ll help Raj in here. Why don’t you go keep my dad company?
Don’t be silly, he loves you.
Okay, he cares about you a lot.
I do crap for you all the time. Get out there.
What?
I don’t know. He’s sweet, he’s tall, handsome.
How’s it going out there?
What are they doing?
So why don’t you do that with them?
What do you mean?
Sorry. I really want to hear how sad you are. I’ll be back in like five, ten minutes.
Hey. Howie says you’ve been making fun of him all day. Now, both of you apologize right now.
It’s okay.
Thanks again for cooking.
Mike: Hi, honey.
Uh, okay, yeah, it’s for everybody. I really just wanted to have a nice, quiet day at home and watch the game.
Thanks. What’s wrong with your mom?
Uh-huh.
A little in college. You?
Listen to Stretch.
I’ve kept my marriage together for 35 years. Can I weigh in here?
I’m trying to watch the game. Shut up. Oh, how do you not make a first down there?
How the hell do you know that?
I’m getting ready to weigh in again.
What do you think they ought to do now?
Yeah, that’s why. You remember the Thanksgiving game when it snowed in Dallas?
I was so pissed, I wanted to shoot my TV.
Yeah.
So, does your dad still live in Texas?
I’m sorry to hear that.
Oh, thanks. So, if your dad died when you were 14, you were never old enough to have a beer with the man.
Well, you’re having one with me.
To your dad.
That is not what I expected when you said you were gonna burp pie.
I don’t know what’s scarier, the bathroom clowns or the woman that put them there.
Me, too.
Mmm.
Hey, Sheldon, what do you say we go outside and throw around the old pigskin?
I know I’m hard on you, but you’re not the worst son-in-law in the world.
Well, I’m drunk.
Zack: It’s all right. I didn’t have anything going on. Plus, Penny told me we’re married, and Thanksgiving’s a time to be with family.
I don’t know if I want to sign it.
I just think splitting up can be rough on kids.
Are you sure? ‘Cause you didn’t know we were married until this morning.
Of course it was an impersonator. We could never afford a real Elvis.
Not cool, bro. I’m starting to think you’re not the kind of guy I want dating my wife.
Know what they say, happy wife, happy life. Let’s eat.
Don’t be. It’s my fault. I was a terrible husband. I was never around.
